title: Product Management Intern
job_description: Our work at NVIDIA is dedicated towards a computing model focused on visual and AI computing. For two decades, NVIDIA has pioneered visual computing, the art and science of computer graphics, with our invention of the GPU. The GPU has also shown to be spectacularly effective at solving some of the most complex problems in computer science. Today, NVIDIA’s GPU simulates human intelligence, running deep learning algorithms and acting as the brain of computers, robots and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world. We are looking to grow our company and teams with the smartest people in the world and there has never been a more exciting time to join our team! What you will be doing:Conduct user experience studies analyzing road users behavior to inspire product decisionsClosely work with product and engineering teams to define the product based on the studies Drive execution across eng and operation teamsTie the issues to root causes and solutions in issue management system (JIRA)What we need to see:Pursuing an MBA (graduating in Dec 2026 or spring 2027)Deep knowledge of issue management tools (i.e. JIRA)3+ years of experience in software engineering or automotive engineeringKnowledge or experience with AV productsWays to stand out from the crowd:Deep knowledge of L2/3 autonomous driving systemsDeep understanding of categorizing incoming product level issues into useful categoriesDeep knowledge of driving product engineering stackPrevious experience working in or closely with a Product Management team.NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers! We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and autonomous, we want to hear from you.Our internship hourly rates are a standard pay based on the position, your location, year in school, degree, and experience. The hourly rate for our interns is 27 USD - 82 USD. You will also be eligible for Intern benefits. ​Applications for this job will be accepted at least until November 28, 2025. NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Computer Engineer Internship - Summer 2026
job_description: In a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. Imagine Next! At Parsons, you can imagine a career where you thrive, work with exceptional people, and be yourself. Guided by our leadership vision of valuing people, embracing agility, and fostering growth, we cultivate an innovative culture that empowers you to achieve your full potential. Unleash your talent and redefine what’s possible. Job Description:Parsons is looking for an amazingly talented Computer Engineering Intern to join our team!Ready to advance your education and have the opportunity to learn about High-Performance Computing, Embedded Systems, and Computational Analysis from experts in the field? Parsons is now accepting applications for interns who have an interest in applying computer engineering skills to cutting-edge technical challenges.Parsons' expertise in complex systems, combined with your willingness to work hard, will propel your career and opportunities forward. We need our interns to be versatile, enthusiastic to work in highly flexible, team-oriented environments that have exceptional communication, analytical, and organizational skills. In this role, you will be under close supervision of a degreed professional and complete routine support assignments. Your assignments are designed to develop a working knowledge of practices and procedures related to software development, computational modeling, and system integration. This is a developmental position for college interns who are pursuing an Engineering or Computer Science degree.What You'll Be Doing:In support of a degreed professional, complete assignments providing software development and computational analysis support to their supervisor/mentor.Support could range from programming, data structure analysis, debugging complex code, developing scripts, or system integration in a fast-paced environment.Assisting in the documentation and testing of software and computer systems.Performs other responsibilities associated with this position as may be appropriate.What Required Skills You'll Bring:Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearanceMust be a U.S. citizenEnrolled in Engineering at an accredited college or university and completed at least one year of studyOrganized and self-motivatedAble to work in a team environmentCompleted at least one year of an undergraduate curriculum and maintain a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA (on a 4.0 scale)What Desired Skills You'll Bring:Have a working knowledge of Data Structures, Algorithms, and Operating Systems fundamentals.Familiarity with programming languages such as C/C++, Python, or Java.Experience or coursework related to embedded systems, parallel computing, or machine learning frameworks.Understanding of revision control systems (e.g., Git).Security Clearance Requirement:NoneThis position is part of our Federal Solutions team.The Federal Solutions segment delivers resources to our US government customers that ensure the success of missions around the globe. Our intelligent employees drive the state of the art as they provide services and solutions in the areas of defense, security, intelligence, infrastructure, and environmental. We promote a culture of excellence and close-knit teams that take pride in delivering, protecting, and sustaining our nation's most critical assets, from Earth to cyberspace. Throughout the company, our people are anticipating what’s next to deliver the solutions our customers need now.Salary Range: $21.88 - $38.27We value our employees and want our employees to take care of their overall wellbeing, which is why we offer best-in-class benefits such as 401K!Parsons is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected status.We truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! Imagine next and join the Parsons quest—APPLY TODAY!Parsons is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices. To learn more about recruitment fraud and how to report it, please refer to https://www.parsons.com/fraudulent-recruitment/.

title: Technology Intern - Digital Analytics-Summer 2026
job_description: Description: Are you ready to spend your summer as part of something special? Imagine working with a Fortune 200 company whose reputation for excellence opens the door to endless opportunities. At Genuine Parts Company (GPC), we offer the chance to work with the best teams on innovative projects in a supportive and dynamic environment. Our employees build long-lasting, rewarding careers and make a real difference in the community. GPC was just awarded one of America’s Greatest Workplaces for Parents & Families by Newsweek. About the Program: Our 10-week summer internship program will be held in-person at our Atlanta headquarters, conveniently located near Windy Hill and I-75. The program runs from June to August 2026. As a technology intern, you will help solve complex business problems by leveraging technology and building scalable solutions. Interns can express their preferences for areas of interest and are assigned to teams based on prior experience and interviews. As digital analytics focused intern, you will work on digital analytics projects that will leverage AI/ GenAI to drive efficiencies and business impact in key areas such driving sales, improving margins, improving customer experience, satisfaction and their overall value to the business. You will work with internal cross-functional teams (Analytics, Ops, Merchandising, Product), to solve business problems and enhance operational efficiency and drive value from our investments in data and AI infrastructure. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to solve real business problems and drive value from our investments in data and AI infrastructure. Examples of projects include: Predictive Analytics: Build advanced machine learning models to forecast critical business metrics such as churn rate, customer lifetime value, sales trends, and demand forecasting to drive strategic decision-making. Classification Models: Develop AI solutions for categorizing customer behavior, product recommendations, risk assessment, and automated content classification to enhance operational efficiency. Customer Segmentation: Apply unsupervised learning techniques including clustering algorithms and dimensionality reduction to discover non-obvious customer segments and behavioral patterns that can unlock new business opportunities and personalization strategies. GenAI Integration: Implement Large Language Model (LLM) solutions via GenAI APIs to create innovative business applications such as: Conversational BI and automated insights generation Customer feedback analysis and workflow automation Intelligent recommendations and decision support systems Agentic AI solutions to activate insights across marketing, sales, and digital operations teams Required Experience and Skills Programming: Proficiency in Python, SQL, with experience in data manipulation, analysis, and model development. Machine Learning: Hands-on experience with ML frameworks (scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) and solid understanding of supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms, model evaluation, and validation techniques. Statistics & Data Science: Strong foundation in statistical analysis, hypothesis testing, advanced analytics, and experimental design. AI Technologies: Familiarity with GenAI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, or similar platforms) Understanding of LLM prompting strategies, finetuning techniques, and integration patterns Basic knowledge of AI agents, agentic workflows, and multi-agent systems Development Tools: Experience with AI coding assistants (GitHub Copilot, Cursor, Windsurf, or similar tools) and modern development practices. Nice to Have Knowledge of digital analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics) Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their AI/ML services Exposure to MLOps practices, model deployment, and production ML systems Understanding of data engineering concepts and ETL processes The projects will be challenging and to help our interns be successful, we are seeking top talent which includes: Rising juniors and seniors (as of summer 2025) enrolled in an undergraduate program with a focus on computer science, digital merchandising, or related technology fields. Preference will be given to applicants with a GPA of at least 3.6. Experience in data analysis, customer experience, and digital operations. Demonstrated passion for learning and applying modern technology tools to create innovative solutions. What our interns can expect: Gain valuable experience and advance your skills while working for an iconic Atlanta-based Fortune 200 company. Network with highly respected Technology leaders (our CIDO and Technology VP’s meet regularly with the interns and attend presentations). These connections can prove invaluable in the job market. We have a highly collaborative work environment, and teammates participating in the intern program are onsite fulltime Monday through Friday. We include some fun company-sponsored events, like attending a Braves game, to help make the summer fun. Explore GPC’s rich history through field trips to various locations, including distribution centers and retail operations. Earn bragging rights, prizes, and opportunities to showcase your tech skills and learn more about a career in technology. Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by joining our Talent Community on jobs.genpt.com or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!GPC conducts its business without regard to sex, race, creed, color, religion, marital status, national origin, citizenship status, age, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability, military status, status as a veteran, or any other protected characteristic. GPC's policy is to recruit, hire, train, promote, assign, transfer and terminate employees based on their own ability, achievement, experience and conduct and other legitimate business reasons.
